headline: Greta: You don't want to miss a chance to see Sgt. Andrew Tahmooressi free and hear from him
subHeadline: Greta's 'Off the Record' commentary, 11/5/14: You will see our Marine finally out of a Mexican prison and hear what he has to say in 'Freed Marine: Sgt. Tahmooressi's Story,' our 1-hour 'On the Record' special. #MarineHeldInMexico

utterances.speaker: SERGEANT ANDREW TAHMOORESSI, MARINE FREED FROM MEXICAN PRISON
utterances.sentences: I was thinking hopefully these guys are going to be considerate and caring, and understanding. But you know I started feeling the things just something shifted there. You know, they were very helpful, and then shifted and I know you know this could be bad. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('tablet', 'lb3', 'tablet-tw-ad-lb3', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } And Sergeant Tahmooressi was so right. It was bad. For 214 days, he was behind bars in Mexico. And after trying to escape, our American marine endured a brutal beating. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('mobile', 'ban3', 'mobile-mw-ad-ban3', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: TAHMOORESSI
utterances.sentences: They started hitting me. Hitting me in the face with open palms, nothing full blown but, you know, just like -- that was actually joyful to take that beating. I was happy about that beating. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('tablet', 'lb4', 'tablet-tw-ad-lb4', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.sentences: Why? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb3', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb3', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('mobile', 'ban4', 'mobile-mw-ad-ban4', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: TAHMOORESSI
utterances.sentences: I knew the beating was coming. They were telling me stories about the guards. About how, you know, if someone acts up or does something wrong, they get beat. So I already knew it was going to happen to me. So I was glad as can be to take that beating. I was like bring it, just bring it on. I was just there joyful knowing that I got away from that place. So the beating didn't bother me. We're going to hear much more from this Marine. He will go "On the Record" for an hour-long special that airs tomorrow night. "Marine Freed: Sergeant Tahmooressi's Story," tomorrow at 7 p.m. You don't want to miss it. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('tablet', 'lb5', 'tablet-tw-ad-lb5', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('mobile', 'ban5', 'mobile-mw-ad-ban5', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } See you tomorrow. Good night from Washington.

utterances.speaker: SERGEANT ANDREW TAHMOORESSI, MARINE FREED FROM MEXICAN PRISON
utterances.utterance: I was thinking hopefully these guys are going to be considerate and caring, and understanding. But you know I started feeling the things just something shifted there. You know, they were very helpful, and then shifted and I know you know this could be bad. And Sergeant Tahmooressi was so right. It was bad. For 214 days, he was behind bars in Mexico. And after trying to escape, our American marine endured a brutal beating.

utterances.speaker: TAHMOORESSI
utterances.utterance: They started hitting me. Hitting me in the face with open palms, nothing full blown but, you know, just like -- that was actually joyful to take that beating. I was happy about that beating.

utterances.speaker: TAHMOORESSI
utterances.utterance: I knew the beating was coming. They were telling me stories about the guards. About how, you know, if someone acts up or does something wrong, they get beat. So I already knew it was going to happen to me. So I was glad as can be to take that beating. I was like bring it, just bring it on. I was just there joyful knowing that I got away from that place. So the beating didn't bother me. We're going to hear much more from this Marine. He will go "On the Record" for an hour-long special that airs tomorrow night. "Marine Freed: Sergeant Tahmooressi's Story," tomorrow at 7 p.m. You don't want to miss it. See you tomorrow. Good night from Washington.
